貪.definition: to have a voracious desire for; to covet; greedy; corrupt

貪多嚼不爛.definition: to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)

貪天之功.definition: to claim credit for other people's achievements (idiom)

貪婪無厭.definition: avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied

貪官.definition: corrupt official; grasping functionary; greedy mandarin

貪官污吏.definition: grasping officials, corrupt mandarins (idiom); abuse and corruption

貪得無厭.definition: avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied

貪得無饜.definition: variant of 貪得無厭|贪得无厌[tan1 de2 wu2 yan4]

貪心不足.definition: avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied

貪戀.definition: to cling to; to be reluctant to give up (sth); to have a fondness for (an indulgence etc)

貪污.definition: to be corrupt; corruption; to embezzle

貪瀆.definition: (of an official) corrupt and negligent of his duty

貪猥無厭.definition: avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied

貪玩.definition: to only want to have a good time; to just want to have fun, and to shy away from self-discipline

貪玩兒.definition: erhua variant of 貪玩|贪玩[tan1 wan2]

貪生怕死.definition: greedy for life, afraid of death (idiom); craven and cowardly; clinging abjectly to life; only interested in saving one's neck

貪色.definition: greedy for sex; given to lust for women

貪財.definition: to be greedy in getting money

貪賄無藝.definition: greed for bribes knows no bounds (idiom); unbridled corruption

貪贓枉法.definition: corruption and abuse of the law (idiom); to take bribes and bend the law
